snippet: A racist song is one window into inequality in Greek life on campuses.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Matthew W Hughey contends racist incident perpetrated by members of University of Oklahoma fraternity points to larger problem of entrenched privilege and racial inequality in fraternities and sororities at American universities; holds issue cannot be easily rectified through surface attempts at integration; maintains Greek system contains qualities worth preserving, but schools must confront its inequalities head on.
lead_paragraph: A racist song is one window into inequality in Greek life on campuses.

headline.main: The University of Oklahoma Video, and the Problem Fraternities Can’t Fix Themselves
